newsitem.title: MALTA: Maltese shares rise in higher turnover.
newsitem.headline: Maltese shares rise in higher turnover.

text.p: The Malta Stock Exchange share index was up by 7.897 points on Wednesday as business picked up in the once weekly trading session.
Turnover reached just over Lm 333,100 ($926,018), almost double last week's total. There were 80 deals, of which 51 were in equities and 29 in fixed income securities.

Business in equities amounted to just over Lm90,100 ($250,470) from the previous week's Lm 40,500 ($113,400) with 68,062 shares being traded. Of these, 29,322 were Bank of Valletta shares which were sold in 27 deals for an average of 125.9 cents, up four mils.
There were 12 deals in Mid-med Bank, with 25,000 shares selling for an average price of 145.1 cents, up from 143 cents last week.
Middle Sea Insurance, shares remained unchanged for the second week, with 7,740 shares changing hands in three deals for an average 121 cents each.
Lombard Bank Malta also traded, with 7,740 shares selling an average 139.4 cents, up from 137.2 when last traded on August 7.
In Simons Farsons Cisk, 1,000 ordinary shares changed hands for 62 cents per share, unchanged.
In the government bond market, 10 issues were dealt in, turnover reaching Lm241,591, up steeply from last week's Lm125,700. Business was mainly in the 6.5 percent MGS 2001 (II).
In corporate bonds, there was one deal in Mid-Med Bank 7.25 percent unsecured loan stock 2005 amounting to Lm1,387.40 at 99.1 cents. (Lm1=$2.78)
